music-bubbles.title: Music Bubbles
music-bubbles.description:
This is an experiment to create a binaural audio experience in augmented reality. Each bubble emits part of the same song. By walking around, the song can be experienced in different ways.

Work in progress / more info soon.

thumbnail.subtitle: Binaural Audio in Augmented Reality experiment

bodies-gallery.title: The Bodies Gallery
bodies-gallery.description:
The Bodies Gallery is a website that celebrates the variety of body shapes and sizes in the world by letting people draw themselves. The proof of concept only contains a way to generate and upload boobs, but ideally, the gallery would contain all kinds of body parts that people feel proud or insecure about.

The website was made for Rutgers, who asked us to come up with a positive and interactive way to combat a toxic social norm of our choosing. In this project, which I did with four others, I was responsible for the development of the site.
bodies-gallery.cta:
Visit the Bodies Gallery

Research, Usability, Conceptual, Copy: Vanessa van den Akker & Fee van Brummelen
Marketing, Branding: Tim van Galen & Claudia Bosch

thumbnail.subtitle: A website celebrating the variety of body shapes and sizes

virtualeye.title: VirtualEye
virtualeye.subtitle: Affordable intimacy for the massess
virtualeye.description: In an age of algorithmic matchmaking, virtual reality porn and ʻrent-a-girlfriendʼ-services, love seems to become more and more commodified. VirtualEye is a dystopian concept in which even something as intimate as eye contact has become a product for consumption. The mixed reality application projects a virtual person onto your surroundings, enabling you to stare into their eyes at any moment, feeling their presence as if it were a real person.

thumbnail.subtitle: A dystopian concept about the commodification of love

self-portrait-i.title: Daniël 2
self-portrait-i.subtitle: A not-so-smart AI self-portrait
self-portrait-i.description: Daniël 2 is a chatbot that uses a machine learning model to generate text messages as if it were me. Its neural network is trained on the 59353 WhatsApp messages I sent over the past five years. The data on which this model is trained encompasses everything I've shared with my closest friends, from my darkest secrets to my deepest crushes. The results are hilariously terrible.
self-portrait-i.cta: See the code and documentation on GitHub

bloclock.title: Bloclock
bloclock.subtitle: A more sensible approach to time
bloclock.description: Bloclock gives you a visual overview of the time in your day that is left and has passed. The clock consists of a 10x10 grid in which each block resembles 10 minutes, adding up to a total of roughly 17 hours, thus showing only the time an average human is awake. When you go to bed, all of your blocks will be gone. This way of time framing makes you more aware of how you spend your time, hopefully leading to less time wasted on things that don't matter.

thumbnail.subtitle: A clock showing you the time you've left before you go to bed

how-many-weeks-left.title: How many weeks left?
how-many-weeks-left.subtitle: Fuel your midlife crisis with statistics
how-many-weeks-left.description: This website calculates your life expectancy based on your birthdate and demographic, showing you how much time of your life you already wasted and, more importantly, how many weeks are left until you (statistically) die. The calculation is based on data by The World Bank Group. Use with caution; feelings of self-loath, remorse, and anxiety may occur.
how-many-weeks-left.cta: Visit howmanyweeksleft.com | See the code on GitHub

piano-game.title: Pianio
piano-game.description: Pianio is an experimental game that is controlled by playing the right note on the right time using a MIDI USB-keyboard.

thumbnail.subtitle: A game playable using Web MIDI keyboard input

studentloan-be-gone.title: Student Loan be Gone
studentloan-be-gone.description:
A good friend told me he was afraid to visit DUO's website, the Dutch governmental body that, among other things, issues student loans. I made him this Chrome extension that replaces the information about your student loan debt with The Communist Manifesto, so you can easily manage your study affairs without being confronted by the crippling debt you have built up.

N.B.: This extension does not necessarily reflect my views on what an ideal society would be like.

thumbnail.subtitle: Chrome extension that replaces your student loan debt with The Communist Manifesto
